content.raw: An additional comment related to this: macros to indicate that a given library is being compiled as a shared library can be defined directly using the [`DEFINE_SYMBOL`](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.8/prop_tgt/DEFINE_SYMBOL.html) property of the target (that defaults to `<target_name>_EXPORTS`). With respect to defining the macro with an `add_definitions(-DBUILDING_DLL)`, in this way you avoid by design to leak the definition to other targets contained in the same directory and subdirectories in whith `add_definitions` is called.
